DataElement.preferredName: Cell Preparation Tube Cryovial Aliquot Plasma Collection Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of cryovial aliquots of plasma that resulted from Cell Preparation Tube (CPT) processing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cell Preparation Tube Cryovial Aliquot Plasma Collection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of mononuclear cells._A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of mononuclear cells.

Concepts.definition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of mononuclear cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.:Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: A vial used to store specimens in a cryopreservative at very low temperatures.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.

Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quantity of the specified item.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Determining the number or amount of something.
